p: Compound 6f was prepared from 2-naphthaldehyde 4 h (0.069 g, 0.44 mmol), 2–(3,4-diaminophenyl)-3,4,5,6-tetrahydropyrimidin-1-ium chloride 3 (0.100 g, 0.44 mmol), and sodium metabisulfite (0.084 g, 0.44 mmol) in dimethyl sulfoxide (0.8 ml). The resulting free base was converted into salt as described below to obtained 0.081 g (50.6%) of beige powder; m.p. >300 °C; 1H NMR (600 MHz, DMSO-d 6) δ 10.25 (s, 2H), 8.80 (d, J = 7.2 Hz, 1H), 8.27 (s, 1H), 8.24 (d, J = 8.6 Hz, 1H), 8.17 (d, J = 7.2 Hz, 1H), 8.13 (d, J = 7.5 Hz, 1H), 7.97 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 1H), 7.83 − 7.74 (m, 2H), 7.73 − 7.65 (m, 2H), 3.55 (m, 4H), 2.03 (m, 2H); 13 C NMR (151 MHz, DMSO- d 6) δ 159.4, 153.3, 133.4, 131.7, 130.1, 129.3, 128.6, 127.7, 126.7, 125.5, 125.3, 124.7, 123.2, 122.6, 115.5, 115.0, 38.9, 17.8
